reviewText: read the book years ago- fun to see the story on the screen

I have always wanted to have this movie on DVD for over 10 years now. I have read the book and watched it on TV but never was able to find the DVD, only recently i was able to find it on amazon and it worth what i payed for, good cover, new DVD discs, and EXCELLENT condition thou it is one of classic movies.

Interesting story with a cast of excellent actors rarely seen these days.
Michael York, Hugh Grant, Lucy Gutteridge, Barry Bostwick and all the other actors are super.

Unlike the other reviewer, I have not seen the original television show, so I am approaching this series with a fresh mind. The actors are excellent, the cast diverse and the story interesting.  Although "soapy" at times, in general, the series is extremely entertaining.  It is far better than 99% of the fare on television. It may not be a masterpiece, but it sure is fun to watch.

When I saw this mini-series on TV for the first time, I was absolutely thrilled with it. I had to buy the VHS. Sure thing, I had to have the DVD as soon as I learned about it. But this DVD-release is unbelieveably badly made: bad sound-quality, bad picture-quality and above all so many cut scenes (!) like the one where Eve meets Alain for the first time or Bruno's grandmother died. So my recommendation to all fans: Keep your hands off this DVD!! It will will make you really aggressive...
